definitions: Presented (someone or something) to another for the first time.
Brought (something, especially a new product, idea, or custom) into use or operation for the first time.
Inserted or brought (something) into a place or situation.
Made (someone) known by name to another in a formal setting.
Presented (a bill or motion) for consideration in a legislative body.
examples: He introduced his wife to his colleagues.
The company introduced a new line of smartphones.
She introduced a new topic into the conversation.
The speaker was introduced by the event organizer.
A bill was introduced in parliament to amend the law.
